game_description: A classic arcade-style game where the player controls a snake that moves around the screen eating food to grow longer. The objective is to eat as much food as possible without colliding with the walls or the snake's own body. As the snake grows, the game becomes more challenging as there is less space to maneuver.
game_requirements: 2D top-down view with grid-based movement system
Snake character that starts with 3-4 segments and grows by one segment when eating food
Food items that spawn randomly on empty grid spaces
Four-directional movement control (up, down, left, right) using arrow keys or WASD
Collision detection for walls and snake body segments
Score system that increases with each food item consumed
Game over screen when collision occurs with restart functionality
Simple pixel art or geometric visual style with contrasting colors
Smooth movement animation with consistent speed
Sound effects for eating food and game over events
Playable on desktop platforms (Windows, Mac, Linux)
Responsive controls with no input lag
Clear visual distinction between snake head, body, food, and boundaries
